Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Service, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Therichpeasant
Reviews.Content: Having not visited Barcleona before, I chose the Hotel Sant Antoni because the area, L'Eixample, is considered one of the better and safer areas at night. Also, it is very close to the Sagrada Familia which was one of the main tourist attractions I wanted to visit in Barcelona. The hotel is quite new (my taxi driver didn't know it existed), and so everything is bright and shiny. The building, breakfast room and guest rooms are all simply and modernly furnsihed. Pros: Friendly and helpful staff; good value for Barcelona; great location about a block and a half from the Monumental subway station and a 5-minute walk to Sagrada Familia; fabulous breakfast (Tip - breakfast is included if you book throughthe hotel website; extra if you book through a travel website); clean and modern rooms; there is a great supermarket called LIDL a few blocks away to get bottled water, drinks, fruit or snacks. Cons: Rooms are quite small and spartan. There is no coffee machine; my shower leaked; there is not a lot of good restaurants in the area, but again, it is close to a subway and downtown is quickly and easily accessible. All-in-all, I would recommend this hotel and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: silviaantonelli
Reviews.Content: Bed Washington quite small,but we got the room on 7th floor,with a huge balcony with table and seats.the hotel is simple,but rooms are clean and staff can also understand italian.breakfast is very good and it a for free if u book it by hotel website.

Reviews.Title: “Honestly, a lot more than a 2 star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ieily
Reviews.Content: First thing first I just want to point out that this is categorized as a 2 star property, even though it is comparable to a 3 star superior in my opinion, so all the reviews saying that breakfast is poor (not true, adequate and good, fresh products too), no fridge in the room, no bar or restaurant just a vending machine and a coins operated computer next to reception (1€ for 5 mins)should just book a full 3 or 4 star property that is required to have all those services. My experience has been a really positive one: Location - the Hotel is reall well located in the safe and residential area of the Eixample, 10 minutes slow walk to Sagrada Familia and a mere 3 minutes from Metro stop "Monumental" which takes you to super central Passeig de Gracia or Universitat on purple metro line L2 in 2-3 stops (buy a metro travelcard at machines in metro stations - a lot cheaper than single tickets). Staff - kind, competent and accomodating without being intrusive. Ask for a wi-fi code to desk staff, they give you a userid and password, only 1 user at a time tho.They also store luggage all day if you have a late flight in a locked room. Rooms - CONS: a little on the small side, decor and layout is fairly basic, a small desk and 1 bedside table only, no table lamps, no tea/coffee facilities. Careful if you have a bathtub getting out of it is really awkward. PROS: super clean rooms; more than adequate wardrobe space, modern and new furniture, comfortable beds (only doubles, no kings!) 2 soft pillows, blankets, laundry service, 21" LCD tv, air con, modern bathroom with big shower but no shelves to put stuff, water pressure always perfect and hot water always present, hairdryer too and plenty of good towels. Stayed 4 nights and been initially given a double room with interconnecting doors we could hear absolutely everything in the room next to us, this means that if you have a quiet and respectful neighbour is ok, like it was the first 3 nights for us but if you get the younger couple who returns late and makes plenty of racket then you are waken up at 3am and it's not a nice thing. We went to reception quite upset and the nice staff clerk told us we could change room first thing in the morning when they would have a free room to give us and so they did, the very next morning we swapped for a room on 4th floor facing the back of the building (much quieter) with no interconnecting doors and much much better in terms of noise. Just so you know avoid the 6th floor (or pick that one accordingly) if you don't smoke because it is the only smoking floor they have. I personally loved this hotel, can't fault it (except for the thin interconnecting door) in any way and will surely be back. Go and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tian R
Reviews.Content: good location, just 5 mins walking to Sagrada Familla. very freindly staff, you can buy the ticket for city sightseeing bus at the reception. Breakfast is just OK.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Trip in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: AutumnStrange
Reviews.Content: Good location, Friendly and helpful staffs, Spacious room and bath, Nice neightborhood and restaurant around the area, and Good rate! The sound insulation for the room need to be improved!

Reviews.Title: “Totally inadequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: nikolaos b
Reviews.Content: the reception staff knows English and helped us to what we asked for! The room had no refrigerator something you really need if you are traveling in a foreign country! Nonexistent location and the internet wasn't free,they charged EUR 0.50 to 2 minutes !!!!! The breakfast was just good! the location was bad! Cleaning moderate and if you go before 16.00 noon to rest there is a possibility your room not cleaned yet!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “you don't get what you see!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: akismdb7
Reviews.Content: located near to sagrada familia i expected a better residence!!!!! cleaning our rooms at 16 00 because they are allowed to clean until 17 00!!!!!!!there is no fridge in the room and we had to pay 1 euro every now and then for small bottles of water!!!!!there was no cafeteria in the hotel, you could only have a cup of coffee until 11 00 when breakfast ends!!!!!!no free internet, you have to pay 50 cents for 5 min. and 6 euros for an hour!!!!!!!!!the room is very small and the double bed....is not double!!!!!though, the staff is really friendly and the breakfast was good!!!!!!but when they told me that i had to pay 21,26 euros for ONE phonecall to athens,greece i really freaked out!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler60950
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about Barcelona! The Hotel Sant Antoni was great! Our room was very small, but very clean and it had a great bathroom (use care getting in and out of shower/tub....it is a little higher than the floor level and it makes access a little treacherous - hold on). The front desk employees were very pleasant, welcoming and helpful. The hotel is VERY close to La Sagrada Familia - a must visit! It is also very convenient to the Metro - which we found to be fabulous.....we took the metro to a staring point each day and then walked and walked and walked - it was such fun - Barcelona is fantastic. The only negative is tha the hotel has very thin walls and hard floors, so sound travels easily - we were not bothered by any noise and slept well as our "neighbors" were quite courteous and respectful.

Reviews.Title: “Really cozy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AGNESSSE
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel for our 4 days trip in Barcelona. At first this hotel is in good location: near the Sagrada Familia. The Rambla street we reach in 10 - 15 minutes by food. Second, I was impresed by very helpful staff! Also the breakfast was enought good as in 2* hotel. The room was modern, clean, not very big. Just one strange thing - the bed was plenty short:) I recommend this hotel for couples, bussines travel in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for budget-conscious travellers”
Reviews.Author: Flavio1976
Reviews.Content: Basic services, small rooms and unimpressive common areas. But, all in all, good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and comftable rooms at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Valencia07
Reviews.Content: I really liked the Hotel San Antoni and it had all I was looking for. The rooms are almost exactly as shown in the photos with new and comfortable beds. Maybe the rooms are a bit basic (no water cooker or minifridge) and small, but clean and with a nice bathroom and a good shower. The rooms are nicely decorated, very modern and bright and the airconditioner is working very well and is easily regulable. Also you can open the windows if you like. The staff is very helpful because I called to get a quite room and they gave us a room towards the back and in one of the upper floors, which was perfect and very silent (apart from the neighbors which you do hear a bit). Also the restaurants recommendation from the person at the front desk was very good and helpful. I fully recommend the hotel if you are not looking for full luxury. It is perfectly equipped, comfortable, good situated (about 20min walk to the center) and is not too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A great base for exploring, a wonderful city!”
Reviews.Author: jgyk18
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights with my girlfriend at this hotel and we were reasonably impressed with the hotel for the price we paid and after looking at previous reviews prior to booking. We were very impressed with the location of the hotel, as it was a mere 2 minutes from the nearest metro- monumental- which you could travel to Passieg de Gracia in very little time, this made it easy to commute and visit the various places around Barcelona- from the beach to further away attractions like Parc Guell. The Sagrada famillia was also a quick five minute walk away and surrounded by some good restaurants if you didn't want to travel far from the hotel at night. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was what we were expecting with a mixture of meats, cheeses, yoghurts, coffee and pastries- although there was the nice addition of a Spanish omelette and eggs. The room was clean and modern, and although it lacked a good view of the surroundings- it was well kept and a good place to spend the night. As many reviews have said the walls were thin and you could hear noise, but we didn't find it much of a problem as it was only really loud throughout the day, but some nights we could hear noises from rowdy people coming back to the hotel. The bathroom was a good size as although slightly small, there was a large mirror and plug right next to it, also the shower was a very good size. There weren't that many amenities in the room such as a safe although you could get reception to place valuables such as passports in their safe, however there was a flat screen TV in the room but it lacked any English channels, although there was a computer downstairs which you could pay to use and free wifi throughout the hotel. Overall it was a very good hotel if you were on a smaller budget looking to spend little time there through the day, and simply wanted to explore the delights of Barcelona. Clean, well kept and safe. Would definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, but paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Jan1168
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my daughter for four days a few weeks ago. The hotel was Excellent value. It was clean, with contemporary interior and the bonus was breakfast that was included in the price. This included, bread to make toast, jam, boiled and scrambled eggs, cold meats, special K, a kids cereal, and a range of pastries such as croissants, brioche etc. Cold but more than adequate for a start to the day. I must mention the coffee machine. Guests had access to this at breakfast time to choose from cappuccino espressos etc. The hotel staff were very pleasant. It is in a great location and very accessible for all the sights. My teenage daughter and I felt safe travelling back as lone women at night time. The one MAJOR downside is that the walls are seriously paper thin! On our first night the adjoining room was empty. On the second night a family of three arrived quite late. When we finally got some quite, the guests were up making phone calls at 4am in the morning! Every movement and noise could be heard. I am marking the hotel down for sleep quality because of this and not because of the beds. The beds were very comfortable. If it wasn't for the walls I would say this was highly recommended and great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jolene101
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights Bed and Breakfast in a triple room. The hotel is basic but very clean and all staff were helpful and friendly. The rooms are small and the walls are thin but as a base to put your head down and have breakfast it was great and there was never any noise at unreasonable times. The nearest metro was a 2 minute walk and you can be at the beach in 20 minutes. Breakfast was continental but had hot omlette and eggs and a nice selection of breads and fruit.I would stay here again and recommend it to anyone looking for clean budget accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for exploring amazing Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: traveller_girl3
Reviews.Content: Basic but clean and modern rooms. Great location (Sagrada Familia just around the corner; metro station few steps away).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Suzieq75
Reviews.Content: Friendly, clean and modern a very short distance from the Sagrada Familia and the metro. Breakfast until 11am and more than enough choice. There are restaurants and bars in the area but you can be in the centre of the city in 15 mins. Rooms are basic but nicely done and very clean. Walls thin so may have been a problem if I had noisy neighbours and no English speaking channels at all but do have Spanish, German and Austrian. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel !! we'l return again :)”
Reviews.Author: shbub
Reviews.Content: we spent 5 nights at the hotel, had a great time. enjoyed the pleasant, clean and neat room. the staff was very kind to us. gave us useful information about barcelona. the hotel location is near a metro stop, but to get to the center of the city u need to take 2 lines of the metro. if u r very hungry in the morning u should'nt count on the hotel breakfast.... :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stumpy118
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. Unless you are really really fussy there is no reason you would not enjoy your stay here! I know everyone says the walls are really thin, which they are, BUT it was only during sociable hours that you could hear people in the next room, there was no noise during the early hours etc. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful, the hotel was modern and very clean and the location was good. The breakfast was basic but still very nice. I would recommend you do the tour bus, which they sell tickets for at the reception in the hotel. Be careful with the taxi drivers as I do think they pretend they don't know where the hotel is to make more money. If you are getting a taxi to the airport ask for a price before hand, it was 25 Euros when we arrived but 40 Euros when we returned!

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Barcelona Hotel”
Reviews.Author: some_boy32
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights as part of a sightseeing trip to Barcleona with my girlfriend. Hotel was basic in terms of facilities etc but was perfect for what we were after - basically a reasonably priced hotel in and around the city centre. Rooms and the hotel in general were nice and modern and well kept. Room had a TV, hairdryer, air con etc and a very nice ensuite bathroom. Location was great, just round the corner from the Monumental metro stop which is 1 stop from the stunning sagrada familia which is one of the main tourist places to visit and also a couple of stops from either Clot station or Passeig de Gracia both of which are on the mainline and allow you to get a train to and from the airport which I would recommend as its nice and easy and cheaper than taxis etc. Didnt have any food or anything from the hotel so cant comment on that (not even sure it did food to be honest, possibly just breakfast) but plenty of places to eat round and about. Staff on reception also really helpful and friendly. Really nice hotel that I would recommend to people staying in Barcelona on a budget sightseeing trip.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern well appointed hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kenamway
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern well appoiinted hotel room. Front desk staff were all friendly/helpful. Broadband WiFi included at no extra charge. 5 minutes walk to Metro. The only downside was that construction was underway on upper floors of the hotel, meaning that constant loud hammering prevented any possibility of an afternoon nap. Overall good value compared to other places - I suspect because you need to take two metro trains to get to most areas of interest like the old city, montjuic, tapas bars in/around Passeig de Gracia etc. It is however about 10 minutes walk from Gaudi's incredible Sagrada Familia (queue up for a ticket before 9am or else be prepared for a two hour wait).

Reviews.Title: “great location-clean-cosy- rooms-excellent breakfast-friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: eliza13066
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a few steps from Diagonal avenue(where you can find big chains of shops ), very close to Sagrada Famiglia, on foot it"s about 15 minutes,very close to Monumental metro station.Also very close to Placa Glories Catalanes,Teatre Nacional de Catalunya,Museo de la Musica .The main street where the hotel is located are shops,cafes ,restaurants.The hotel is 2 years old building,excellent -chic design,the rooms are big enough with a grande bathroom,the staff is really friendly & helpful,very good breakfast!!!.It IS rated as A 2* hotel But actually I WOULD DEFINATELY SAY THAT THIS HOTEL IS A 3*SUP -GOOD QUALITY FOR ITS PRICES.The only disadvantage is that the rooms have thin walls & you can hear other people talking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, Good Location, Very Clean, Poor Breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: nalod
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days in Sept, very close to metro good location overall. Very clean hotel, room ample size, good shower, toilet. Other people have talked about some noise from thin walls, I did not find this a problem and slept well here. Air con good. Nice area. The staff are excellent. The breakfast was a problem, Bread boring, plastic ham and one type of cheese, some cereals, very limited fruit. The breakfast needs a total overhaul and rapidly, the coffee was excellent. The other thing I found unusual was the safe. It looked like a kitchen press and sometimes when you asked for your belongings back they just pulled the door open and took out you envelope, there did not seem to be any code or unlocking. That said all my stuff was always safe but the procedure looked casual. The free wi fi was also frustrating sometimes work sometimes slow needs improvement. It still is a value for money Hotel with nice staff in a good location, but please with a little effort improve the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, good area and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: EefBarcelona
Reviews.Content: I live in Barcelona and had my parents over for a week. Because hotel Sant Antoni is just around the corner from where I live, they stayed in this hotel. I have to say they had a very pleasant stay with a very nice room with walk in shower and enjoyed the friendlyness of the staff and the nice breakfast. The area is nice with lots of bars for a cup of coffee and you can walk around 24 hours a day without any problems. I would like to recomment this hotel. If I have to name one downside it would be the noice high heels can make on wooden floors. My parents had a lady in the room above theirs and the heels and the moving of the beds during cleaning made noise, but appart from that everything was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable but could be improved”
Reviews.Author: Hausa
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at this small and new hotel. It is acceptable although nothing really special. Very conveniently located (near the Sagrada Familia and just 400 m walk from the subway station) and staff very friendly. I think however that it could be better, if we keep in mind that it was inaugurated in june and we stayed in August. We were assigned a room that had a leak from the bathrrom sink. I'm surprised the housekeeping staff did not noticed. We complaint about it and were re-assigned to a new room with same characteristics. We noticed the floor wasn't too clean, but decided to let it go hoping next morning it would be mopped. However it wasn't, although the room and bathroom were cleaned that day. One thing to keep in mind is that walls are so thin you can (unfortunatelly) hear your neighbours walking down the corridor or simply searching in a plastic bag in their rooms, not to mention if someone decides to say (not to yell) a word. Breakfast are good and assorted, there is WIFI internet available in the building and a payable public computer in case you need one. Room and shower were spacious and the bed was specially comfortable. It is well situated and allowes to visit the city by foot or by public transportation.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Sant Antoni
HotelInfo.Address: Consell de Cent, 476, 08013 Barcelona, Spain
